full_text: Page 856 To: (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) @gmail.com Subject: Re: Jeffrey Epstein, 76318-054 Good morning (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) With apologies for the delay, medical staff can accept his CPAP machine. Would you or one of your associates be able to bring it in next week? It must be provided to medical staff rather than directly to your client. Thank you, (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) >>> (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) @gmail.com> 7/26/2019 9:50 AM >>> Mr (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) Is Mr. Epstein approved to receive a CPAP machine? If so, should we send it directly to him through the inmate mail system? Please confirm. Thank you. (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) Esq. 810 Seventh Ave., Ste. 620 New York, NY 10019 646-801-(b)(6); (b)(7)(C) Page 1577 DOJ-OGR-00025165

text_blocks.content: Good morning (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) With apologies for the delay, medical staff can accept his CPAP machine. Would you or one of your associates be able to bring it in next week? It must be provided to medical staff rather than directly to your client.
Mr (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) Is Mr. Epstein approved to receive a CPAP machine? If so, should we send it directly to him through the inmate mail system? Please confirm.

additional_notes: The document is an email exchange regarding Jeffrey Epstein's CPAP machine. Multiple personal details are redacted.
